etymology.description: pictogram: dehusked rice kernels; horizontal stroke as a bamboo sieve; cf. 粟 (with husk); unrelated to 木/禾/来.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts dehusked rice grains being sifted on a bamboo sieve, contrasting with 粟 which shows husked kernels. Despite visual resemblance, its form is not derived from 木, 禾, or 来.

examples.chinese: 我买了两斤米(我買了兩斤米)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le liǎng jīn mǐ.
examples.english: I bought two jin of rice.

examples.chinese: 这家店的东北米很香(這家店的東北米很香)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn de Dōngběi mǐ hěn xiāng.
examples.english: The Northeastern rice at this shop is very fragrant.

examples.chinese: 请把米洗一洗(請把米洗一洗)，再煮饭(再煮飯)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ mǐ xǐ yì xǐ, zài zhǔ fàn.
examples.english: Please rinse the rice, then cook it.
